channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The currency is collapsing, protestors are on the streets, and people are lining up for subsidized bread. Inside Turkey's economic turmoil. https://t.co/CsvPdZs5cA

An explosion shook the area near Iran’s main nuclear-enrichment plant Saturday, prompting conflicting explanations from Iranian officials as Tehran engages in talks over its nuclear program https://t.co/daC3Y8XrfN
Eighty years ago, Japanese submariner Kazuo Sakamaki took part in the surprise attack on Pearl Harbor—and became his country’s first prisoner of war. https://t.co/VUyo5uSJ95
The United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia are reopening diplomatic missions and restarting flights as they try to match Qatar’s sway in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan https://t.co/6NCptXOLFW

Home buyers in high-cost areas of the U.S. will be able to borrow nearly $1 million for a mortgage loan backed by the government, a reflection of the rapid appreciation in home prices nationally https://t.co/p1NbM9KGMc

“I am very lucky in my life that I have benefited from second chances, and I am aware that other people don’t even get first chances.” Ben Affleck talks Jennifer Lopez, fame, infamy, addiction and finally getting satisfaction—or as close to it as he’ll get https://t.co/1atjGnWGuQ
Adele said she will perform at a four-month long residency in Las Vegas early next year https://t.co/MmKm07OiUx
From @WSJopinion: Lockdowns don't stop the virus, and vaccine mandates are hurting hospitals. The Omicron variant is no excuse for more of either one. https://t.co/BfiC0cEOGY
Tesla came to China with big plans. China had even bigger plans for Tesla. https://t.co/U1abEcEKKE
Apple’s vision for life after the iPhone is coming into view, writes @mims https://t.co/WLDWQuDiPM
CNN anchor Michael Smerconish will temporarily fill in for Chris Cuomo next week, the cable network said https://t.co/DBkTBAiDbX

From @WSJopinion: The Biden administration at some point will realize that its political fortunes are tied to a virus that isn’t going anywhere, writes @KimStrassel. The longer it takes to make a clean break, the likelier it is to succumb to Covid. https://t.co/cTglXdmoip
CNN fired Chris Cuomo for his role in the sexual-harassment scandal that led to the resignation of his brother, former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo https://t.co/30R4zHktSz

A woman using the pseudonym Jane testified in federal court that Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell gave her money, bought her gifts including underwear and repeatedly sexually abused her beginning when she was 14 https://t.co/S8qFyvVNvf

Some alumni groups, driven by politically moderate or conservative baby boomers, say college campuses have been overtaken by progressive groupthink—and they’re not sending any more checks until something is done about it https://t.co/6f8Inrppzf

A total solar eclipse is happening Saturday. But only a few thousand people—and penguins—will see it in-person. Here's how to watch it if you can't cruise around the South Orkney Islands. https://t.co/oP2VGiBzxX
The Omicron variant may lead to more infections but vaccinated people will likely remain protected from severe disease, vaccine maker BioNTech's founder said https://t.co/SNFjz8o13E

French President Emmanuel Macron traveled to Saudi Arabia to meet Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who since the 2018 murder of Jamal Khashoggi hasn’t visited the U.S. or Europe and has been largely shunned by Western leaders https://t.co/IGIrVvc6tX

The Women’s Tennis Association said that its largest Chinese sponsor iQiyi, a Netflix-like streaming platform, asked to be removed from the WTA’s website as the organization spoke out about Peng Shuai https://t.co/nGJqwQBQtX
Biden will require travelers to the U.S. to provide a negative Covid test within a day of departure and will extend transit mask rules to slow Omicron's spread https://t.co/N3y7HOZTHH
The parents of the Michigan high-school shooting suspect were found and arrested, police said, hours after they were charged with involuntary manslaughter https://t.co/s60atCpSVV
Evidence is building that immunity from Covid-19 infection is at least as strong as that from vaccination. Scientists are divided on the implications for vaccine policy. https://t.co/ceZEPLmcwD
"They look like living conifer cones." The scaly, ant-eating pangolin is trying to usurp the giant panda as the animal kingdom's goodwill ambassador. https://t.co/G50FMAhoFp
Doctors say early evidence suggests Omicron is more transmissible and presents higher reinfection risk, but more time is needed to assess its severity. https://t.co/ZVBAWMaXwb
China has approved the creation of one of the world’s largest rare-earths companies to aim to maintain its dominance in the global supply chain of the strategic metals https://t.co/4C0GiKsLZp

From @WSJopinion: Infectious disease will always be with us, writes @EVKontorovich. It cannot become an excuse to give the federal government carte blanche to control the lives of citizens. https://t.co/x7nWHBDvXz
Apple’s vision for life after the iPhone is coming into view https://t.co/P4bOWA9A1P

Russian President Vladimir Putin is amassing a force expected to total 175,000 troops near Russia’s border with Ukraine, giving him the capability for a potential invasion by early 2022, according to Biden administration officials https://t.co/9HGE2K0CMO

A total solar eclipse is happening Saturday. But only a few thousand people—and penguins—will see it in-person. Here's how to watch it if you can't cruise around the South Orkney Islands. https://t.co/yOLUsAZcGG
Turkey's president has taken control of its economy. The lira is collapsing, protesters are in the streets. "Everyone here is outraged.” https://t.co/QJqU3J0gwG

At least 64 out of about 120 fully vaccinated people who attended a party in Norway tested positive for Covid-19, with at least 13 confirmed to have the Omicron variant (corrects a now-deleted tweet that said 64 people tested positive for the variant) https://t.co/joUHnKSvWW https://t.co/R4jkAjEKhG

At least 64 out of 120 fully vaccinated people who attended a Christmas party in Oslo, Norway, tested positive for the Omicron variant, providing an early data point on the ease through which it spreads between vaccinated people https://t.co/R0qbOs4yg4

Breaking: Prosecutors charged the parents of Ethan Crumbley, the Michigan high-school student accused of killing four classmates this week, with four counts of involuntary manslaughter in connection with the gun used in the shootings https://t.co/seiUxCfGVF
Selected by the editors of the @WSJBooks pages, here are this year’s most distinguished works of fiction and nonfiction https://t.co/CG1HMeKwx0

Max Martin, the Swedish songwriter-producer behind hits by Britney Spears, Katy Perry and Taylor Swift, is tied with George Martin of Beatles fame for the most No. 1 hits among producers—and is poised to break the record https://t.co/WmhaWVtJbk
"They look like living conifer cones." The scaly, ant-eating pangolin is trying to usurp the giant panda as the animal kingdom's goodwill ambassador. https://t.co/GdXRuOVhT0
A roughly 40-acre Bahamas private island known as Little Pipe Cay, last listed for $85 million in 2018, is back on the market for $100 million https://t.co/EMqM3PgDnR

Scientists in South Africa tracking the spread of Omicron say they are seeing a rise in reinfections in people who had recovered from Covid-19, suggesting previous infection provides reduced protection against the new variant https://t.co/a2CksCF54G
The Senate passed an extension of government funding and sent the bill to Biden, averting a shutdown after resolving a standoff over vaccine rules https://t.co/h0v19cdVpR
China has long dispatched pandas to zoos around the world in gestures of goodwill. Taiwan's scaly pangolin now wants a shot at center stage. https://t.co/HkEghnSMKp

Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell had a strict rule for employees at his Palm Beach, Fla., estate: “See nothing, hear nothing, say nothing.” A former staff member described working on the estate in Maxwell’s sex-trafficking trial Thursday. https://t.co/5e6b4KgTZi
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/K8JGgzQ1fd
Meghan Markle claimed victory in her legal battle against a British tabloid that published a letter the former actress sent to her father https://t.co/Ucm1J0Mtj5
China has long dispatched pandas to zoos around the world in gestures of goodwill. Taiwan's scaly pangolin now wants a shot at center stage. https://t.co/L3ytuDI2by

Scientists in South Africa tracking the spread of Omicron say they are seeing a rise in coronavirus reinfections in people who had recovered from Covid-19, suggesting previous infection provides reduced protection against the new variant https://t.co/xRPoEk35UM
The U.S. and Mexico reached a deal to restart the Trump-era Remain in Mexico policy. Asylum seekers will be sent back while their claims are considered. https://t.co/Wofiq7S5MC
Democrats and Republicans reached an agreement to extend government funding through Feb. 18, the first step toward avoiding a shutdown this weekend https://t.co/EkZwDH83ek

Chinese authorities protested the departure of international women’s tennis amid concerns over the safety of star player Peng Shuai, while at the same time moving to suffocate a brief flurry of online chatter about the news https://t.co/fABN4ETUAu
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/8x6btK5IwG
Glaxo’s antibody treatment was found to be effective against Omicron, setting it apart from therapies that appear to work less well against the coronavirus variant https://t.co/qY2TUC1zlL
